results.title: The Debate continues...
results.brief_description: Tells the history of the House of Commons, shows how it carried on after the Chamber was bombed in 1941 and illustrates the construction and opening of the new Chamber by H.M. the King George VI. Contains archival footage.

results.title: Death row
results.creator_credit: Bruce Jackson, Diane Christian and Documentary Research
results.brief_description: The film portrays the daily life of 114 men housed in the special death cells of Ellis prison, Texas. Some of the condemned men discuss their relationships with their families and attorneys and how they fill the years between fixing of a death sentence by a judge and ultimate resolution in freedom, commutation or death by lethal injection.

results.title: The Death penalty?
results.brief_description: In Britain death is the penalty for only a few specified crimes, but there is still a great deal of controversy about capital punishment. Here the evidence for and against is discussed by the Public Hangman, prominent churchmen, chiefs of police and murderers themselves. Relatives of victims also express their views.

results.title: The Death of Socrates
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Charles W. Russell and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description: A reconstruction of 399BC in Athens where Socrates, judged guilty of the corruption of youth and of refusal to recognize accepted gods of state faces execution according to Athenian law by drinking poison. Those who had been his main accusers said they did not desire his death but Anytus the politician who caused the trial refuses to reverse his judgement. In prison where a small group of friends have gathered Socrates speaks of the values he has cherished. Without being able to discourse daily about virtue and the greatest good of man he has no reason to live. He drinks poison and as friends weep, dies. Narrated by Walter Cronkite. Cast includes John Cassavetes as Plato, Robert Culp as Xenophon, E.G. Marshall as Aristophanes, Shepperd Strudwic as Crito, Milton Selzer as Melitus and Richard Kiley, Michael Higgins, Barry Jones, Philip Bourneuf, Grant Gordon and Victor Thorley.

results.title: Death of a legend
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Wolf is an endangered species in Canada, threatened by man and his technology, largely because of unfounded myths that have grown up around it. This study attempts to disprove the fallacies, showing the wolf’s life cycle, the social organisation of the pack and the wolf’s role in maintaining the balance of nature. (Awards: Toronto; New York; Brussels)

results.title: Death: coping with loss
results.creator_credit: Bill Mackie, Larry Pont and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Presents discussions of fears about dying, terminal illness, responding to loss, funerals and comforting the bereaved. Examines reactions and attitudes of various people towards death.

results.title: Dearborn holiday
results.creator_credit: Jerry McMechan, Ford Motor Company and MPO Productions
results.brief_description: Many people visit Dearborn to see cars of the present turned out at the Ford Motor Company Works. Cars of the future are on view at the Ford Rotunda. Other tourist attractions are the Henry Ford Museum and Greenfield Village, centres for a historic collection, including both the early years of the Ford motor car and such diverse objects as Thomas Edison’s laboratory and the Cape Cod windmill built by the Pilgrims.

results.title: Dealing with drought
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows how some farmers and graziers managed their properties to cope with drought conditions in various parts of Queensland and New South Wales between 1964 and 1967. Shows how the problem can be met successfully in several ways to minimise its effects including hand feeding, reducing stock, and use of underground water. Emphasises the importance of adopting a definite plan to provide for the bad years and changing circumstances.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bern Gandy, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Deadly females
results.brief_description: A spider spins a silken web with which to ensnare its food; a moth is caught. Next the trapdoor spider uses its silk glands to construct its home and conceal the entrance with a perfectly hinged door. Two male scorpions fight for the favour of a female of the species, and the victorious male is later devoured by the female in a nuptial feast.

results.title: Dead centre
results.brief_description: There are many kinds of centres: centres of dart boards, baby health centres, fathers who are the centres of their family. There is also the centre of the road: the drivers who stay on it are likely to end up in the dead centre - the Coroner’s Court.
